1.brief: properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

2.brief: physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a skin-bag for liquids (from collapsing when empty); hence, a vase (as similar in shape when full); also a lyre (as having a body of like form)
ten; by abbreviated form ten strings, and so a decachord
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music

3.brief: to be (causative) make well, literally (sound, beautiful) or figuratively (happy, successful, right)
properly, to thrum, i.e. beat atune with the fingers; expectation. to play on astringed instrument; hence (generally), to make music
clamor, i.e. acclamation of joy or a battle-cry; especially clangorof trumpets, as an alarum

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
literally firmness; figuratively security; morally fidelity

5.brief: to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

6.brief: a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)

7.brief: water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)

8.brief: to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
the earth (as moist and therefore inhabited); by extension, the globe; by implication, its inhabitants; specifically, a particular land, as Babylonia, Palestine
